title: How to Enter Proxy Settings in Firefox

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. Its app icon resembles a blue globe with an orange fox wrapped around it.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . This icon is in the top-right corner of the Firefox window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Options.
steps.content: Click Options . You should see this option in the middle of the drop-down menu. Doing so opens the settings page. On a Mac or Linux computer, click Preferences instead.

steps.title: Click General.
steps.content: Click General . It's a tab on the left side of the Firefox window. If this tab is blue, Firefox is already on the General tab.

steps.title: Scroll down to the "Network Proxy" section.
steps.content: Scroll down to the "Network Proxy" section. It's at the very bottom of the Firefox page.

steps.title: Click Settings….
steps.content: Click Settings… . This button is on the far-right side of the page. Doing so will open the Proxy Settings window.

steps.title: Check the "Manual proxy configuration" box.
steps.content: Check the "Manual proxy configuration" box. This option is near the top of the window.

steps.title: Enter your proxy information.
steps.content: Enter your proxy information. You'll need to fill out the following fields: HTTP Proxy - Your proxy server's IP address goes here. Port - The server's port number goes here.

steps.title: Check the "Use this proxy server for all server protocols" box.
steps.content: Check the "Use this proxy server for all server protocols" box. It's directly below the "HTTP Proxy" field.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . It's at the bottom of the window. Doing so will save your settings.
